blurb: Antimicrobial Peptides: immune foot soldiers that are quick-acting, deadly, and on the front lines
description: How do we survive infections when some types of bacteria can double their population as quickly as a run of a sitcom episode (twenty minutes) while our adaptive immune system takes a few days to produce antibodies and T cells in our defense? What defenses does our body use in the meantime to keep the infection under control?
title: Antimicrobial Peptides: Your Body's Homeland Security
